page.title: 03CHELTENHAM FACTS AND FIGURES
page.content:
MUNICIPAL OFFICE STATISTICS.
Mayor of CHELTENHAM 1985 Councillor P.PENNELL.
{ Population}in URBAN BOROUGH 100,000 in 1985 ( estimated 110,000 by turn of the century). 15,561 are pensioners - of whom 1100 die each year. As 1000 babies are born each year the trend is towards a younger population, however the unemployment rate is 10%. 1200 children start school each year. 300 students take A LEVELS annually.
4000 foreigners live in Cheltenham - many of Polish and Italian extraction.
1,900,000{tourists}spend an estimated Â£5,000,000 annually. Gold Cup Week accounts for much of this revenue with a massive Irish influx at this time.
